text: understand something right off the bat
this Kia retails for nearly 42 grand
well it is fully loaded this is the 2014
cadenza named after the musical term not
furniture I'm Tom Volk with driven for
the new york times kia is aiming this
full-size sedan and upscale buyers it's
marketing won't include dancing hamsters
cadenzas two main rivals are Impala and
Avalon comparing fully loaded models the
Kia's MSRP is the same as the Chevy
about a grand less than the Toyota but
price isn't everything is it there's
also that issue of quality kia delivers
the leather is supple these would look
appropriate on cars twice as expensive a
10 year 100,000 mile powertrain warranty
inspires confidence and maintenance is
free for three years or thirty seven
thousand five hundred miles the front
wheels are driven by a refined 3.3 liter
direct injected v6 making 293 horsepower
the six-speed Automatic does its job
smoothly shift yourself if you want
in music a cadenza is an exciting
powerful solo performance that seems
fitting the zero to sixty time is around
six and a half seconds the chassis
structure is solid and composed not much
body roll in corners cadenza is quiet at
highway speeds the ride quality is on
the firm side comfortable steering is
nicely weighted not an awful lot of Road
feel though it's something that key has
yet to master fuel economy I'm seeing 1
or 2 miles per gallon better than the
EPA's 19 city 28 highway rating and no
I'm not babying it inside cadenza keeps
tempo with competitors hard to tell the
wood is from plastic trees the soft
touch instrument panel looks rich wish
the door releases felt that way no
trendy ambient lighting strips in the
cockpit but warning chimes border on
orchestral radar assisted cruise control
can bring the car to a full stop nice
for road trips
visibility is great from every angle the
wheel and seats are heated but only the
driver's chair is cooled explain that to
your significant other on a hot day the
carpool gang should be pretty happy back
here there's plenty of head knee leg and
foot room but the person in the middle
is gonna whack their head for reference
on 5 foot 9 the outboard positions get
bun warmers no separate climate zone or
power port though it bends and seat
backs do not fold flat obviously not so
great if you carry a lot of long
packages anything wider than this and
you're out of luck there's a spare not
all cars get those these days in the end
so to speak cadenza scores a 7 in the
tipi trunk test one less than Impala
headed up by Audi alum Peter Schreyer
Kia's design team has been getting
standing ovations lately cadenzas lines
are less emotional than optima and
Sportage more mature starting at just
under 36 grand which includes leather
and navigation cadenza performs well
against its rivals even
Frugal Lexus es350 shoppers might want
to take a test-drive
the main thing missing on cadenza is a
premium badge if you're only trying to
impress yourself you don't really need
one of those
